intro: Claoxylon echinospermum, commonly known as the spiny seed tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and large, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by distinctive, spiny fruits that contain hard, angular seeds. It thrives in humid, lowland areas and is often found in secondary forests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest in both botanical research and conservation efforts.
